capabilityDescription.en: Fetches parameters from files, in the format provided by Kubernetes mounted secrets.  Parameter groups are indicated by a set of directories, and files within the directories map to parameter names. The content of the file becomes the parameter value.  Since Kubernetes mounted Secrets are base64-encoded, the parameter provider defaults to Base64-decoding the value of the parameter from the file.
capabilityDescription.zh: Fetches parameters from files, in the format provided by Kubernetes mounted secrets.  Parameter groups are indicated by a set of directories, and files within the directories map to parameter names. The content of the file becomes the parameter value.  Since Kubernetes mounted Secrets are base64-encoded, the parameter provider defaults to Base64-decoding the value of the parameter from the file.

en.description: The maximum byte size of a parameter value.  Since parameter values are pulled from the contents of files, this is a safeguard that can prevent memory issues if large files are included.

zh.description: The maximum byte size of a parameter value.  Since parameter values are pulled from the contents of files, this is a safeguard that can prevent memory issues if large files are included.

en.description: Indicates how parameter values are encoded inside Parameter files.

zh.description: Indicates how parameter values are encoded inside Parameter files.

en.description: A comma-separated list of directory absolute paths that will map to named parameter groups.  Each directory that contains files will map to a parameter group, named after the innermost directory in the path.  Files inside the directory will map to parameter names, whose values are the content of each respective file.
